subject: Re: [junit] Automated Method Testing (AMT) Pattern
msgSnippet: Hi Marvin, I m extremely impressed. Having the below stated criteria for the definition is really Smart , and personally I think the definition does a great
messageBody:
Hi Marvin,

I'm extremely impressed.
Having the below stated
criteria for the definition
is really "Smart", and personally
I think the definition does a great
job of facilitating discussion.

Incidentally, we had a
discussion somewhat related
to this on this thread:

http://www.nabble.com/100---Method-Testing-and-Generating-Unit-Tests-tf2902785.html


I also sent a link to the Apache Tuscany
group for the Road to SOAj page. I think
they are going to be equally impressed.

Thank you for sharing this with us. Please
let me know if there is anything I can do to help.

Cheers,
- Ole



Marvin Toll wrote:
>
>
>
> A first-cut definition for the "Automated Method Testing" pattern
> utilizes the "Core J2EE Patterns" format.
>
> If you have not been exposed to AMT - I'd appreciate any feedback on
> this definition that values brevity:
>
> http://gtcgroup.com/soaj/Road.to.SOAj.html#AMT
> <http://gtcgroup.com/soaj/Road.to.SOAj.html#AMT>
>
> Feedback includes (but is not limited to):
>
> * Clarity (Does the definition adequately explain the pattern?)
> * Scope (Is the definition scoped effectively?)
> * Usefulness (Does the definition promote concept discussion?)
>
> Thanks,
> Marvin
>
SNIP
